    • Method Detail

      • linearCombinationFactory

        public static ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric linearCombinationFactory(ImageCore image,
                                                                   boolean allowSignedValues)
        Factory to generate an instance allowing to perform linear combinations with other images, or similar operations such as set constant values. There are mainly two policies to perform these operations: with signed values or with unsigned values. Due to unsupported unsigned values in java, the implementation of some operations differs depending on the policy, thus leading to two derived classes.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to process
        allowSignedValues - If true, the gray levels are shifted to start in the middle of the range of a short value.
        Returns:
        The instance of the relevant linear combinations implementer
        See Also:
        ImageEmbedSigned, Note that the input image is assumed to hold values allowing, to some extent, the linear operations to be performed without incurring overflows. Use {@link #embedValues(allowSignedValues)} if necessary to ensure this precondition.

      • getZero

        public abstract int getZero()
        Description copied from interface: ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        The zero value, as obtained using an unsigned int, depends on the type of image (signed or unsigned), and the bits per voxel. If the image is unsigned, then the unsigned value of zero is realy zero. If the image is signed, then it can be obtained by a shift with the relevant integer value.
        Specified by:
        getZero in interface ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Returns:
        The value representing zero in this image representation
        See Also:
        ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getZero()

      • getImageEmbedding

        public ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric getImageEmbedding(boolean allowSignedValues,
                                                     int bitDepth)
        Description copied from interface: ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Produces an image with a given bit depth that can hold greater values than the original image. In case the bit depth of the input image is equal to the target bit depth, the input image is replaced by the new one. Use ImageCore.duplicate() to override this behaviour. The purpose is to allow operations such as difference or linear combination of images without overflows. If the original image is GRAY8 and the target bit depth is 8, then the values are divided by 32, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. If the original image is GRAY16 and the target bit depth is 16, then the values are divided by 512, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. If the original image is GRAY8 and the target bit depth is 16, then the values copied as is into the new image, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. If the original image is GRAY16 and the target bit depth is 8, then the values are divided by 512*16 = 8192, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value.
        Specified by:
        getImageEmbedding in interface ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Parameters:
        allowSignedValues - If true, the gray levels are shifted to start in the middle of the range of a short value.
        bitDepth - The target bit depth
        Returns:
        This instance to allow for use of the Cascade Design Pattern. that can contain greater values. The reference is that of the original image in case that image has type GRAY16;
        See Also:
        ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int)

      • getImageSignedClamp

        public ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric getImageSignedClamp()
        Description copied from interface: ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Allows to retrieve a signed representation of the underlying image data without changing the number of bits per pixels. Consequently, this might result in a loss of data. Loss of data can be avoided for GRAY8 images by using ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int) or can be minimized by dividing all values by 2.
        Specified by:
        getImageSignedClamp in interface ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Returns:
        This instance to allow for use of the Cascade Design Pattern.
        See Also:
        ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageSignedClamp()

      • copyInto

        public ImageSignPolicyEmbed copyInto(ImageSignPolicyEmbed destImageSignPolicyEmbed,
                                     VoxelInt shiftMargin,
                                     boolean scaleForBitDepth)
        Description copied from interface: ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Copies this image into another image, which must have been previously allocated. The voxel's coordinates of the input image are translated (shifted) before being copied into the destination image. If the original image is GRAY8 and the target bit depth is 8, then the values are divided by 16, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. If the original image is GRAY16 and the target bit depth is 16, then the values are divided by 256, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. If the original image is GRAY8 and the target bit depth is 16, then the values copied as is into the new image, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. If the original image is GRAY16 and the target bit depth is 8, then the values are divided by 256*16 = 4096, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. The destination image's calibration and other metadata is merged with that of the original image (and replace for parameters that already exist in the destination image's metadata). The implementation might require that both source and destination images should be defined on the same Image Processing Framework (i.e. Created by the same ImageCore factory).
        Specified by:
        copyInto in interface ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Parameters:
        destImageSignPolicyEmbed - The destination image into which the voxels gray levels should be copies, swapping two coordinates in the voxels' domain.
        shiftMargin - The destination voxel Vd has coordinates (Vs + shiftMargin), where Vs is the source voxel's coordinate vector.
        scaleForBitDepth - If true and the two images involved have different bit depth, the colors is multiplied or divided by 256 to adjust gray scales.
        Returns:
        The reference to destinationImage for use in the cascade pattern
        See Also:
        ImageSignPolicyEmbed.copyInto(ImageSignPolicyEmbed, VoxelInt, boolean)

      • copyFrom

        public ImageSignPolicyEmbed copyFrom(ImageSignPolicyEmbed destImageSignPolicyEmbed,
                                     VoxelInt shiftMargin,
                                     boolean scaleForBitDepth)
        Description copied from interface: ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Copies an image, which must have been previously allocated, into this image. The voxel's coordinates of the input image are translated (shifted) before being copied into the destination image. If the original image is GRAY8 and the target bit depth is 8, then the values are divided by 16, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. If the original image is GRAY16 and the target bit depth is 16, then the values are divided by 256, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. If the original image is GRAY8 and the target bit depth is 16, then the values copied as is into the new image, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. If the original image is GRAY16 and the target bit depth is 8, then the values are divided by 256*16 = 4096, allowing squares of gray levels to fit into a voxel value. The destination image's calibration and other metadata is merged with that of the original image (and replace for parameters that already exist in the destination image's metadata). The implementation might require that both source and destination images should be defined on the same Image Processing Framework (i.e. Created by the same ImageCore factory).
        Specified by:
        copyFrom in interface ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Parameters:
        destImageSignPolicyEmbed - The destination image into which the voxels gray levels should be copies, swapping two coordinates in the voxels' domain.
        shiftMargin - The destination voxel Vd has coordinates (Vs + shiftMargin), where Vs is the source voxel's coordinate vector.
        scaleForBitDepth - If true and the two images involved have different bit depth, the colors is multiplied or divided by 256 to adjust gray scales.
        Returns:
        The reference to the image underlying this instance for use in the cascade pattern
        See Also:
        ImageSignPolicyEmbed.copyInto(ImageSignPolicyEmbed, VoxelInt, boolean)

      • getOpposite

        public ImageSignPolicyEmbed getOpposite()
        Description copied from interface: ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Changes a signed image into its opposite. If the image is unsigned, the result is zero.
        Specified by:
        getOpposite in interface ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:

      • getReversedValues

        public ImageSignPolicyEmbed getReversedValues()
        Description copied from interface: ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Changes a signed image into a reversed image. In the case of a signed image, we get the same as ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getOpposite() MINUS ONE (because the range is not symmetrical). In case of an unsigned image, we compute newValues = (white-values).
        Specified by:
        getReversedValues in interface ImageSignPolicyEmbed
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getReversedValues()
